intro: Scleria arcuata, commonly known as the zigzag sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and grass-like leaves that often have a zigzag pattern along their edges. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as along stream banks or in swampy areas. Scleria arcuata produces small, three-lobed flowers that are usually pale green or brown, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of its stems.
